node.title: Tasmania introduces vaccine mandate for childcare workers one day before border opens
node.alt: A bald headed man in a suit stands in front of a Covid safe sign
node.description: Tasmanian Premier Peter Gutwein announcesÂ all childcare workers will have to be vaccinated against COVID-19, after pressure from the sector.
node.content: ["Tasmanian Premier Peter Gutwein has announced that all childcare workers will have to start getting vaccinated against COVID-19\u00a0from January, after pressure from the sector.", "Mr Gutwein said workers would have until January 8, 2022\u00a0to show they had had at least one dose of a vaccination.\u00a0", "Public Health director Mark Veitch said he recognised the \"concern\" that had been raised about small children in childcare who have no COVID vaccine available to them.", "\"It is a fact that small children are far less likely to experience complicated coronavirus infection and the illness is almost always mild,\" he said.", "\"However I think there are some justifications that have led me to decide to mandate vaccination for workers in that sector.\"", "Dr Veitch said one reason to mandate vaccinations for childcare workers was that it would help limit the spread of the virus.", "\"By vaccinating childcare workers extensively, that will also help limit the spread of infection from childcare workers back out to the community,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"We know that infection can spread in childcare centres and in schools amongst children.\"", "He said it would also help keep childcare services operating.", "\"The workers in these services are limited and there's a required number of workers to manage specified numbers of children,\" he said.", "\"A small loss of workers from that service can disrupt the service to quite a number of children and also the parents who rely upon the sector to look after children when they're working.\"", "More to come."]
